templates.title: Caddy
templates.name: caddy
templates.description: Still the only web server to use TLS automatically and by default. Deploy and scale HTTPS effortlessly with Caddy 2.

templates.title: Pritunl
templates.description: Enterprise Distributed OpenVPN, IPsec and WireGuard Server.

env.name: DEBUG
env.label: Debug
env.description: Set to true for extra entrypoint script verbosity for debugging

env.name: MONGODB_URI
env.label: Mongodb
env.description: Sets the URI Pritunl will access for the Mongo DB instance

env.name: PRITUNL_OPTS
env.label: Pritunl Options
env.description: Any additional custom run options for the container pritunl process

env.name: REVERSE_PROXY
env.label: Reverse proxy
env.description: Set to true to set the pritunl web interface to run in reverse-proxy mode (Traefik/nginx)

env.name: WIREGUARD
env.label: Wireguard
env.description: Set to true, Switches web interface back to port 443 and HTTPS if running wireguard with reverse-proxy (Traefik/nginx)

templates.title: Pritunl with Fake Api
templates.description: Enterprise Distributed OpenVPN, IPsec and WireGuard Server.

env.name: DEBUG
env.label: Debug
env.description: Set to true for extra entrypoint script verbosity for debugging

env.name: MONGODB_URI
env.label: Mongodb URI
env.description: Sets the URI Pritunl will access for the Mongo DB instance

env.name: PRITUNL_OPTS
env.label: Pritunl Options
env.description: Any additional custom run options for the container pritunl process

env.name: REVERSE_PROXY
env.label: Reverse proxy
env.description: Set to true to set the pritunl web interface to run in reverse-proxy mode (Traefik/nginx)

env.name: WIREGUARD
env.label: Wireguard
env.description: Set to true, Switches web interface back to port 443 and HTTPS if running wireguard with reverse-proxy (Traefik/nginx)

templates.title: Onedrive
templates.description: A free Microsoft OneDrive Client which supports OneDrive Personal, OneDrive for Business, OneDrive for Office365 and SharePoint.
templates.note:
Sources : https://github.com/abraunegg/onedrive
Docs : https://github.com/abraunegg/onedrive/tree/master/docs
Using the alpine image tag

env.name: ONEDRIVE_UID
env.label: Onedrive UserID
env.description: UserID (UID) to run as

env.name: ONEDRIVE_GID
env.description: GroupID (GID) to run as
env.label: Onedrive GroupID

env.name: ONEDRIVE_VERBOSE
env.label: Onedrive Verbose
env.description: Controls "--verbose" switch on onedrive sync. Default is 0

env.name: ONEDRIVE_DEBUG
env.description: Controls "--verbose --verbose" switch on onedrive sync. Default is 0
env.label: Onedrive Debug

env.name: ONEDRIVE_DEBUG_HTTPS
env.description: Controls "--debug-https" switch on onedrive sync. Default is 0
env.label: Onedrive Debug HTTPS

env.name: ONEDRIVE_RESYNC
env.label: Onedrive Resync
env.description: Controls "--resync" switch on onedrive sync. Default is 0

env.name: ONEDRIVE_DOWNLOADONLY
env.description: Controls "--download-only" switch on onedrive sync. Default is 0
env.label: Onedrive Download Only

env.name: ONEDRIVE_UPLOADONLY
env.description: Controls "--upload-only" switch on onedrive sync. Default is 0
env.label: Onedrive Upload Only

env.name: ONEDRIVE_LOGOUT
env.description: Controls "--logout" switch. Default is 0
env.label: Ondrive Logout

env.name: ONEDRIVE_REAUTH
env.description: Controls "--reauth" switch. Default is 0
env.label: Onedrive Reauth

env.name: ONEDRIVE_AUTHFILES
env.description: Controls "--auth-files" option. Default is ""
env.label: Onedrive AuthFiles

env.name: ONEDRIVE_AUTHRESPONSE
env.label: Onedrive AuthResponse
env.description: Controls "--auth-response" option. Default is ""

env.name: ONEDRIVE_DISPLAY_CONFIG
env.description: Controls "--display-running-config" switch on onedrive sync. Default is 0
env.label: Ondrive Display Config

templates.title: Authelia
templates.description: Authelia is an open-source authentication and authorization server and portal fulfilling the identity and access management (IAM) role of information security in providing multi-factor authentication and single sign-on (SSO) for your applications via a web portal. It acts as a companion for common reverse proxies.

env.name: AUTHELIA_JWT_SECRET_FILE
env.description: Defines the secret used to craft JWT tokens leveraged by the identity verification process. This can a random string. It’s strongly recommended this is a Random Alphanumeric String with 64 or more characters.
env.label: JWT secret

env.name: AUTHELIA_SESSION_SECRET_FILE
env.label: Session secret
env.description: The secret key used to encrypt session data in Redis.  It’s strongly recommended this is a Random Alphanumeric String with 64 or more characters.

env.name: AUTHELIA_STORAGE_POSTGRES_PASSWORD_FILE
env.label: Postgres Password
env.description: The password paired with the username used to connect to the database.  It’s strongly recommended this is a Random Alphanumeric String with 64 or more characters and the user password is changed to this value.

env.name: AUTHELIA_STORAGE_ENCRYPTION_KEY_FILE
env.label: Encryption Key
env.description: The encryption key used to encrypt data in the database. We encrypt data by creating a sha256 checksum of the provided value, and use that to encrypt the data with the AES-GCM 256bit algorithm.  The minimum length of this key is 20 characters.  It’s strongly recommended this is a Random Alphanumeric String with 64 or more characters.

templates.title: PostgreSQL
templates.name: postgresql
templates.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 35 years of active development that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.

templates.title: LLDAP
templates.name: lldap
templates.description: This project is a lightweight authentication server that provides an opinionated, simplified LDAP interface for authentication. It integrates with many backends, from KeyCloak to Authelia to Nextcloud and more !

templates.title: AdGuardHome
templates.name: adguard-home
templates.description: AdGuard Home is a network-wide software for blocking ads and tracking. After you set it up, it'll cover ALL your home devices, and you don't need any client-side software for that.

templates.title: AdGuardHome Sync
templates.name: adguard-home-sync
templates.description: Synchronize AdGuardHome config to replica instances.

templates.title: Homepage
templates.name: homepage
templates.description: A modern (fully static, fast), secure (fully proxied), highly customizable application dashboard with integrations for more than 25 services and translations for over 15 languages. Easily configured via YAML files (or discovery via docker labels).

templates.title: Docker Socket Proxy
templates.name: dockerproxy
templates.description: This is a security-enhanced proxy for the Docker Socket.

templates.title: Caddy with Cloudflare DNS
templates.name: caddy
templates.description: Still the only web server to use TLS automatically and by default. Deploy and scale HTTPS effortlessly with Caddy 2.

templates.title: Acme.sh
templates.name: acme.sh
templates.description: An ACME Shell script: acme.sh
templates.note: Acme.sh run as daemon so you need to use docker exec to execute any acme.sh commands.

templates.title: SearX-NG
templates.name: searx-ng
templates.description: SearXNG is a free internet metasearch engine which aggregates results from more than 70 search services. Users are neither tracked nor profiled. Additionally, SearXNG can be used over Tor for online anonymity.

templates.title: Nginx Proxy Manager
templates.name: nginx-proxy-manager
templates.description: Nginx Proxy Manager enables you to easily forward to your websites running at home or otherwise, including free SSL, without having to know too much about Nginx or Letsencrypt.

templates.title: Watchtower
templates.name: watchtower
templates.description: A container-based solution for automating Docker container base image updates.

env.name: WATCHTOWER_LABEL_ENABLE
env.label: Filter by enable label
env.description: Update containers that have a "com.centurylinklabs.watchtower.enable" label set to true.

env.name: TZ
env.label: Time Zone
env.description: Sets the time zone to be used by WatchTower's logs and the optional Cron scheduling argument (--schedule). If this environment variable is not set, Watchtower will use the default time zone: UTC. To find out the right value, see this list, find your location and use the value in TZ Database Name, e.g Europe/Rome.

env.name: WATCHTOWER_CLEANUP
env.label: Cleanup
env.description: Removes old images after updating. When this flag is specified, watchtower will remove the old image after restarting a container with a new image. Use this option to prevent the accumulation of orphaned images on your system as containers are updated.

env.name: DOCKER_HOST
env.label: Docker host
env.description: Docker daemon socket to connect to. Can be pointed at a remote Docker host by specifying a TCP endpoint as "tcp://hostname:port".

templates.title: Wakapi
templates.name: wakapi
templates.description: A minimalist, self-hosted WakaTime-compatible backend for coding statistics.

env.name: WAKAPI_PASSWORD_SALT
env.label: WAKAPI_PASSWORD_SALT
env.description: Pepper to use for password hashing

env.name: WAKAPI_PORT
env.label: WAKAPI_PORT
env.description: Port to listen on

env.name: WAKAPI_DB_TYPE
env.label: WAKAPI_DB_TYPE
env.description: Database type (one of sqlite3, mysql, postgres, cockroach)

env.name: WAKAPI_DB_NAME
env.label: WAKAPI_DB_NAME
env.description: Database name

env.name: WAKAPI_DB_HOST
env.label: WAKAPI_DB_HOST
env.description: Database host

env.name: WAKAPI_DB_PORT
env.label: WAKAPI_DB_PORT
env.description: Database port

env.name: WAKAPI_DB_USER
env.label: WAKAPI_DB_USER
env.description: Database user

env.name: WAKAPI_DB_PASSWORD
env.label: WAKAPI_DB_PASSWORD
env.description: Database password

env.name: WAKAPI_MAIL_ENABLED
env.label: WAKAPI_MAIL_ENABLED
env.description: Whether to allow Wakapi to send e-mail (e.g. for password resets)

env.name: WAKAPI_MAIL_SENDER
env.label: WAKAPI_MAIL_SENDER
env.description: Default sender address for outgoing mails (ignored for MailWhale)

env.name: WAKAPI_MAIL_PROVIDER
env.label: WAKAPI_MAIL_PROVIDER
env.description: Implementation to use for sending mails (one of [smtp, mailwhale])

env.name: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_HOST
env.label: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_HOST
env.description: SMTP server address for sending mail (if using smtp mail provider)

env.name: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_PORT
env.label: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_PORT
env.description: SMTP server port (usually 465)

env.name: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_USER
env.label: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_USER
env.description: SMTP server authentication username

env.name: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_PASS
env.label: WAKAPI_MAIL_SMTP_PASS
env.description: SMTP server authentication password

env.name: WAKAPI_EXPOSE_METRICS
env.label: WAKAPI_EXPOSE_METRICS
env.description: Whether to expose Prometheus metrics under /api/metrics

env.name: WAKAPI_ALLOW_SIGNUP
env.label: WAKAPI_ALLOW_SIGNUP
env.description: Whether to enable user registration

env.name: ENVIRONMENT
env.label: ENVIRONMENT
env.description: Whether to use development- or production settings

templates.title: Nextcloud Linuxserver.io
templates.name: nextcloud
templates.description: Where are your photos and documents? With Nextcloud you pick a server of your choice, at home, in a data center or at a provider. And that is where your files will be. Nextcloud runs on that server, protecting your data and giving you access from your desktop or mobile devices.

templates.title: Adminer
templates.name: adminer
templates.description: Adminer (formerly phpMinAdmin) is a full-featured database management tool written in PHP. Conversely to phpMyAdmin, it consist of a single file ready to deploy to the target server. Adminer is available for MySQL, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite, MS SQL, Oracle, Elasticsearch, MongoDB and others via plugin.

env.name: ADMINER_PLUGINS
env.description: This image bundles all official Adminer plugins. You can find the list of plugins on GitHub: https://github.com/vrana/adminer/tree/master/plugins.  To load plugins you can pass a list of filenames in ADMINER_PLUGINS
env.label: ADMINER_PLUGINS

env.name: ADMINER_DESIGN
env.description: The image bundles all the designs that are available in the source package of adminer. You can find the list of designs on GitHub: https://github.com/vrana/adminer/tree/master/designs.  To use a bundled design you can pass its name in ADMINER_DESIGN
env.label: ADMINER_DESIGN

env.name: ADMINER_DEFAULT_SERVER
env.description: You can specify the default host with the ADMINER_DEFAULT_SERVER environment variable. This is useful if you are connecting to an external server or a docker container named something other than the default db
env.label: ADMINER_DEFAULT_SERVER

templates.title: PGadmin
templates.name: pgadmin
templates.description: pgAdmin 4 is a web based administration tool for the PostgreSQL database.

env.name: PGADMIN_LISTEN_PORT
env.label: PGADMIN_LISTEN_PORT
env.description: Default: 80 or 443 (if TLS is enabled)  Allows the port that the server listens on to be set to a specific value rather than using the default.

env.name: PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL
env.label: PGADMIN_DEFAULT_EMAIL
env.description: This is the email address used when setting up the initial administrator account to login to pgAdmin. This variable is required and must be set at launch time.

env.name: PGADMIN_DEFAULT_PASSWORD
env.label: PGADMIN_DEFAULT_PASSWORD
env.description: This is the password used when setting up the initial administrator account to login to pgAdmin. This variable is required and must be set at launch time.

env.name: PGADMIN_DISABLE_POSTFIX
env.label: PGADMIN_DISABLE_POSTFIX
env.description: Default: <null>  If left unset, a Postfix server will be started to deliver password reset emails.  If set to any value, the Postfix server will not be started, and pgAdmin will need to be configured to use an external mail server using the PGADMIN_CONFIG_ options below.  This option is useful if you’re running in an environment that prevents the use of sudo to start Postfix, or if you wish to use an external mail server.

templates.title: Redis 1go
templates.name: redis
templates.description: Redis is an open-source, networked, in-memory, key-value data store with optional durability. It is written in ANSI C.
templates.note: You need to manualy set the memory limit in portainer

templates.title: Redis 2go
templates.name: redis
templates.description: Redis is an open-source, networked, in-memory, key-value data store with optional durability. It is written in ANSI C.
templates.note: You need to manualy set the memory limit in portainer

templates.title: Redis 3go
templates.name: redis
templates.description: Redis is an open-source, networked, in-memory, key-value data store with optional durability. It is written in ANSI C.
templates.note: You need to manualy set the memory limit in portainer

templates.title: Redis 4go
templates.name: redis
templates.description: Redis is an open-source, networked, in-memory, key-value data store with optional durability. It is written in ANSI C.
templates.note: You need to manualy set the memory limit in portainer

templates.title: Nextcloud Official FPM
templates.name: nextcloud
templates.description: A safe home for all your data. Access & share your files, calendars, contacts, mail & more from any device, on your terms.

env.name: POSTGRES_DB
env.label: POSTGRES_DB
env.description: Name of the database using postgres

env.name: POSTGRES_USER
env.label: POSTGRES_USER
env.description: Username for the database using postgres

env.name: POSTGRES_PASSWORD
env.label: POSTGRES_PASSWORD
env.description: Password for the database user using postgres

env.name: POSTGRES_HOST
env.description: Hostname of the database server using postgres
env.label: POSTGRES_HOST

env.name: NEXTCLOUD_ADMIN_USER
env.label: NEXTCLOUD_ADMIN_USER
env.description: Name of the Nextcloud admin user

env.name: NEXTCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD
env.description: Password for the Nextcloud admin user
env.label: NEXTCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD

env.name: REDIS_HOST
env.label: REDIS_HOST
env.description: (not set by default) Name of Redis container

env.name: REDIS_HOST_PORT
env.description: (default: 6379) Optional port for Redis, only use for external Redis servers that run on non-standard ports.
env.label: REDIS_HOST_PORT

env.name: REDIS_HOST_PASSWORD
env.label: REDIS_HOST_PASSWORD
env.description: (not set by default) Redis password

templates.title: Rclone
templates.name: rclone
templates.description: Rclone is a command-line program to manage files on cloud storage. It is a feature-rich alternative to cloud vendors' web storage interfaces. Over 40 cloud storage products support rclone including S3 object stores, business & consumer file storage services, as well as standard transfer protocols.

templates.title: Whoogle Search
templates.name: whoogle
templates.description: Get Google search results, but without any ads, javascript, AMP links, cookies, or IP address tracking. Easily deployable in one click as a Docker app, and customizable with a single config file. Quick and simple to implement as a primary search engine replacement on both desktop and mobile.

env.name: EXPOSE_PORT
env.label: EXPOSE_PORT
env.description: The port where Whoogle will be exposed.

env.name: HTTPS_ONLY
env.label: HTTPS_ONLY
env.description: Enforce HTTPS.

env.name: WHOOGLE_AUTOCOMPLETE
env.label: WHOOGLE_AUTOCOMPLETE
env.description: Controls visibility of autocomplete/search suggestions. Default on -- use '0' to disable.

env.name: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_DISABLE
env.label: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_DISABLE
env.description: Hide config from UI and disallow changes to config by client

env.name: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_LANGUAGE
env.label: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_LANGUAGE
env.description: Set interface language

env.name: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_THEME
env.label: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_THEME
env.description: Set theme mode (light, dark, or system)

env.name: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_ALTS
env.label: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_ALTS
env.description: Use social media site alternatives (nitter, invidious, etc)

env.name: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_VIEW_IMAGE
env.label: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_VIEW_IMAGE
env.description: Enable View Image option

env.name: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_GET_ONLY
env.description: Search using GET requests only
env.label: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_GET_ONLY

env.name: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_URL
env.default: :root { /* LIGHT THEME COLORS */ --whoogle-logo: #4c4f69; --whoogle-page-bg: #eff1f5; --whoogle-element-bg: #bcc0cc; --whoogle-text: #4c4f69; --whoogle-contrast-text: #5c5f77; --whoogle-secondary-text: #6c6f85; --whoogle-result-bg: #ccd0da; --whoogle-result-title: #7287fd; --whoogle-result-url: #dc8a78; --whoogle-result-visited: #e64553; } #whoogle-w { fill: #1e66f5; } #whoogle-h { fill: #d20f39; } #whoogle-o-1 { fill: #df8e1d; } #whoogle-o-2 { fill: #1e66f5; } #whoogle-g { fill: #40a02b; } #whoogle-l { fill: #d20f39; } #whoogle-e { fill: #df8e1d; }
env.label: WHOOGLE_CONFIG_URL
env.description: The root url of the instance (https://<your url>/)

env.name: WHOOGLE_TOR_SERVICE
env.label: WHOOGLE_TOR_SERVICE
env.description: Enable/disable the Tor service on startup. Default on -- use '0' to disable.
